Posts.Content: Hi everyone I have obtained a copy of my pathology report for my employers critical illness plan and have just had wide local incision on breast with guide wires and lymph node removal of which first 6 nodes had cancer in them. I now have to have CT scan and then see oncologist re chemo. Does anyone know what HER 2 IHC 1 + (Negative) means??. I ask questions but get told all can be discussed as my oncology appointment which is in a different hospital and that I will have chemo and radiotherapy and then drug treatment. I only got diagnosed a month ago and have already had surgery and things are moving very fast and I keep being told what will happen next but I don't seem to be involved in making any decisions. Its as though one hospital has done their bit and I am being passed on to another not really knowing what will happen. Anyone else in this situation? would be grateful for any comments to put my mind at rest a bit. Thanks Poppy

Posts.Content: Thank you it is all becoming clearer now, there is so much to take in and deal with I have never experienced anything like it!!

Posts.Title: HELP Breast cancer results interpretation

Posts.Content: Hi I had my last chemo 3 weeks ago and the PICC line removed on the same day. I really thought I was going to pick up now and enjoy Christmas until this week when I have had loads of problems. My arm swelled and after going in and having a scan they discovered two blood clots but said it was unusual to have happened 3 weeks after the line was taken out. I am doing blood thinning injections but has anyone else experienced this and how long does it take for the clots to dissolve and for the swelling to subside. I keep asking the question at oncology but they won't commit and just say could be a while!!  Would be good to hear other peoples experiences.  Thanks Poppy
Posts.Title: PICC Line and Blood clots

Posts.Content: Hi Cham I had my lumpectomy and 9 lymph nodes removed at the end of April and was only in pain for a few days after surgery, however, 2 months on and in the last 2 weeks or so like you I have developed a fair amount of pain, mostly stabbing and shooting pains in my breast and have been told this is due to the swelling from the operation and the numbness I had around the incisions having subsided and the nerves coming back to life!!  Apart from the pain I do not have the other symptoms you have of sweating and maybe you should go back and get this checked. Hope the pain gets better for you soon. Poppy
